And all we that be here present, will love you much the better

sp.speaker: D. Rat.
sp.l: My part is the worst, but since you all here on agree.
Go even to master Bayly, let it be so for me,

sp.speaker: Bayly.
sp.l: How sayst thou diccon, art content this shall on me depend

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: Go to Master Bayly say on your mind, I know ye are my friend?

sp.speaker: Bayly.
sp.l: Then mark ye well, to recompense this thy former action
Because thou hast offended all, to make them satisfaction,
Before their faces, here kneel down, and as I shall thee teach.
For thou shalt take on oath, of hodges leather breech
First for master Doctor, upon pain of his curse,
Where he will pay for all, thou never draw thy purse,
And when ye meet at one pot, he shall have the first pull,
And thou shalt never offer him the cup, but it be full.
To goodwife chat thou shalt be sworn, even on the same wise
If she refuse thy money once, never to offer it twice.
Thou shalt be bound by the same here, as thou dost take it
When thou mayst drink of free cost, thou never forsake it:
For gammer gurtons sake, again sworn shalt thou be
To help her to her needle again if it do lie in thee
And likewise be bound: by the virtue of that
To be of good abearing to Gib her great Cat:
Last of all for Hodge, the oath to scan,
Thou shalt never take him, for fine gentleman.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Come on fellow Diccon I shall be even with thee now.

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: Thou wilt not stick to do this Diccon I trow.

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: No by my fathers skin, my hand down I lay it?
Look as I have promised, I will not deny it,
But Hodge take good heed now, thou do not beshite me.

body.stage: And gaue him a good blow on the buttocke.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Gog's heart thou false villain dost thou bite me?

sp.speaker: Bayly
sp.l: What Hodge doth he hurt thee or ever he begin.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: He thrust me into the buttock, with a bodkin or a pin,
I say Gammer, Gammer?

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: How now Hodge, how now:

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Gods malt Gammer gurton.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: Thou art mad I trow.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Will you see the devil Gammer.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: The devil son, god bless us.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: I would I were hanged Gammer.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: Marry se ye might dress us.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: I have it by the mass Gammer

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: What not my needle Hodge?

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Your Needle Gammer, your needle.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: No fie, dost but dodge.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: I have found your needle Gammer, here in my hand be it.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: For all the loves on earth Hodge, let me see it.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Soft Gammer.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: Good Hodge.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Soft I say, tarry a while.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: Nay sweet Hodge say truth, and do not me beguile.

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: I am sure on it I warrant you: it goes no more a stray

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: Hodge when I speak so fair: wilt still say me nay:

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Go near the light gammer this well in faith good luck:
I was almost undone: it was so far in my buttock

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: It is mine own dear needle Hodge, sikerly I wot

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: Am I not a good son gammer, am I not,

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: Christs blessing light on thee, hast made me forever

sp.speaker: Hodge
sp.l: I knew that I must find it, else I could a had it never

sp.speaker: Chat.
sp.l: By my troth Gossip gurton, I am even as glad
As though I mine own self as good a turn had:

sp.speaker: Bayly.
sp.l: And I by my conscience, to see it so come forth,
Rejoice so much at it, as three needles be worth.

sp.speaker: D. Rat.
sp.l: I am no whit sorry to see you so rejoice.

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: Nor I much the gladder for all this noise:
Yet say gramercy Diccon, for springing of the game.

sp.speaker: Gamer
sp.l: Gramercy Diccon twenty times, o how glad I am ,
If that I could do so much, your masterdom to come hither,
Master Rat, goodwise Chat, and Diccon together:
I have but one halfpenny, as far as I know it,
And I will not rest this night, till I bestow it.
If ever ye love me, let us go in and drink.

sp.speaker: Bayly.
sp.l: I am content if the rest think as I think?
Master Rat it shall be best for you if we so do,
Then shall you warm you and dress yourself too.

sp.speaker: Diccon
sp.l: Soft sirs, take us with you, the company shall be the more,
As proud comes behind they say, as any goes before,
But now my good masters since we must be gone
And leave you behind us, here all alone:
Since at our last ending, thus merry we be ,
For Gammer Gurtons needle sake, let us have a plaudity.
